sub_title: Designer & researcher based in Rotterdam. IMR & OC Secretary at Willem de Kooning Academy.
summary:
Eva Garibaldi (b. Ljubljana, 1996) is a multidisciplinary designer and published researcher from Slovenia, based in Rotterdam. She holds a BA in Industrial Design from the Academy of Fine Arts and Design in Ljubljana, Slovenia (2018) and a Master of Interior Architecture: Research + Design (Cum Laude) at the Piet Zwart Institute in Rotterdam (2021). Her graduation project ‘The Unstable Ground’ was a finalist for the WdKA Master Research Award. Her written work has been published in several publications (Pekinpah, MIARD Piet Zwart Institute, Soapbox Journal). She has presented her design work at multiple design weeks (Milan, Eindhoven, Berlin) and BIO27 in Ljubljana. Her practice is critical and multidisciplinary, engaging with topics focusing on environmental issues. Through her projects, she uncovers local vernacular stories to address broader issues related to ecological collapse. Together with Ana Laura Richter she is the founder of Swamp_Matter a critical research, art and design practice based between Rotterdam and Ljubljana.

https://evagaribaldi.com/
https://www.instagram.com/swamp_matter/

education.degree_name: Master Interior Architecture: Research + Design (Piet Zwart Institute)
Academy of Fine Arts and Design

awards.title: Young Balkan Designers 2022 Winner
awards.description:
Young Balkan Designers theme for 2022 – “Life Hacks for Health & Wellbeing” calls for design projects, objects, concepts, services, scenarios, and inventions that create a “shortcut” between sustainable living and wellbeing, provoking conversation on alternative and “outside of the box” approach to designing and re-imagining healthier everyday worlds: at home, at school or work, in public, in our intimate and community spaces, urban and rural environments, in our physical and digital realms.

Young Balkan Designers (YBD) is a regional talent platform founded in 2011 with the aim to identify, promote and develop creative potential of the Balkan region in the field of design. The initiative also aims at unifying the regional design scene, bringing it closer to the international audience, strengthening its potential by providing additional education and practice, while at the same time contributing to the restoration of multi-cultural cooperation in the Balkan region.

awards.title: Finalist WdKA Master Research Award 2021
awards.description: The Willem de Kooning Academy Research Award was established by the Willem de Kooning Foundation in 2015 to emphasize the central role of art and design research within the newly introduced curriculum. The Willem de Kooning Research Awards are not prizes for just theses or research documents but for projects merging theory and practice where art or design work is a vital part of the research.

awards.title: Cum Laude
awards.issuer: Piet Zwart Institite, Willem de Kooning Academy Rotterdam

awards.title: Made in Slovenia collection for design exellence
awards.description: Paper + Bioplastic awarded with the badge of design excellence Made in Slovenia. The project is presented within a collection recognized in the world as a good Slovenian design, promoting sustainable principles and contributing to cooperation between the creative and economic sectors. The Made in Slovenia badge recognizes that the product is designed and at least 50% made in Slovenia, sustainable, technologically and design-wise innovative, thoughtful, clear, and functional.

awards.title: Tunnel XXIX, Slovenian Design Pavilion
awards.description: Paper + Bioplastic selected as part of exhibition Tunnel XXIX: Design for a post-apocalyptic world, which will be presented in the context of the Slovenian Design Pavilion to be presented at Milan Design Week 2021
awards.issuer: Centre for Creativity & Museum of Architecture and Design

awards.title: Speaker at Circular Economy Stakeholder Platform 2019
awards.description: Presentation of Paper + Bioplastic project at the Creative Innovation for a Circular Economy workshop led by Ladeja Godina Košir at the Circular Economy Stakeholder Conference in Brussels in 2019. The project was chosen as one of 3 finalists of the open call Creative Circular by Circular Change and Center for Creativity (Museum of Architecture and Design Ljubljana).

awards.title: Award for Special Achievements for Extracurricular Activities / UTOPIA BY DESIGN
awards.description: Award for special achievements and active participation in extracurricular activities, awarded by the rector of the University of Ljubljana for short film Utopia by Design. The film was broadcast as an integral part of the cultural-artistic program entitled “Tuning: Concert for the Two-Million Orchestra” prepared by Boris Benko and Primož Hladnik for the national celebration for the Day of Independence and Unity of Slovenia in December 2017. Produced in collaboration with Simon Bregar, Lin Gerkman, Jakob Koncut, Tjaša Mužina, and mentor Barbara Predan.

publications.publisher: Spatial Folders: Extraction — A trans-scalar inquiry

authors.headline: Designer & researcher based in Rotterdam. IMR & OC Secretary at Willem de Kooning Academy.

profile_positions.description: The Institute Works Council (Instituutsmedezeggenschapsraad or IMR) is a statutory advisory body which represents the views of students and staff members in consultations with management. The rights and obligations of the Institute Works Council are defined by statutory law. The Institute Works Council has a right of assent in matters regarding the budget, the Course and Examination Regulations, and the professionalization plan. The Institute Works Council has a right to be informed in organizational matters and may provide advice upon request as well as proactively. The Institute Works Council is also required to monitor issues related to discrimination and harassment.
profile_positions.title: IMR Board Secretary

profile_positions.description: Project management and production of MIARD23’ Graduation Show in Gallery 3, Het Niewe Instituut, Rotterdam.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager MIARD23' Graduation Show

profile_positions.description: Project management and event production for MIARD22’ Graduation Show in HuidenClub, Rotterdam.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager MIARD22' Graduation Show

profile_positions.description:
Coordination of Master Interior Architecture: Research + Design program within the Piet Zwart Instituut. Pivotal role between students and teaching team, working in close connection with the course director. Varying tasks from communication with students, staff, and external parties, admissions, organizing assessments as well as following the students’ academic progress. Additional role as project manager of the graduation show and liaison between PZI Archipelago Student group and the institute.

MIARD

Interior Architects today are faced with a changing world of new realities, technologies, socio-political, environmental and economic challenges; consequently the practice of the designer needs to expand, react and determine future roles. The Piet Zwart Institute houses the international Master programmes of the Willem de Kooning Academy at Hogeschool Rotterdam. Since 1999 it has been dedicated to promoting study and research in the fields of art, design and art education.

http://miard.pzwart.nl
profile_positions.title: Course Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Guiding Spatial Design Bachelor students in the research phase of the project and assisting undergraduate faculty of the Spatial Design BA at WdKA.
profile_positions.title: Teacher Assistant

profile_positions.description: Commissioned student contribution for the MIARD Accreditation Report in collaboration with Leila El-Kayem, under supervision of course director.
profile_positions.title: Student Contribution for MIARD Accreditation Report

profile_positions.description: Leading the Paper + Bioplastic educational workshop for children exploring concepts of circular design and sustainability by learning through play and making of the biocomposite material Paper + Bioplastic designed by me.
profile_positions.title: Workshop Facilitator: Paper + Bioplastic

profile_positions.description: Working in the role of Junior Designer in 507 Studio, a global design and production house, specializing in custom high-tech retail furniture for luxury brands such as Guerlain, Dior, By Terry, Gucci... I worked full-time in the Beauty department focused on smaller elements of furniture in which my role was 3D modeling, making technical drawings for producers, and preparing the graphics. Oftentimes I also assisted at the in-house workshop with the production of the custom pieces. In the beginning, I worked under the mentorship of a senior designer, in the last 6 months I was overseeing the projects assigned to me more or less independently.
profile_positions.title: Junior Designer & Project Manager
